title: Standard Medium
content:
I am novice in the business of typography so you have to pardon the ignorance in my question, but it goes like this:   
What happened to Standard Medium, the typeface used in the New York City Subway Transit?   
   
I am cannot find it in any library of typeface. It is not a widespread type. I cannot find a digital version. I am troubled by this. I want to know where I can find it. The graphics were commissionned to Unimark, and done by Bob Noorda in Milan, the Graphics standards manual was done by Massimo Vignelli in New York.
author: anonymous

comments.content: There are lots of incarnations of "Standard" but it usually refers to Berthold Akzidenz Grotesk. There are plenty of digital versions of this available.
